intro: Lantana boyacana, commonly known as the Colombian lantana, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Colombia. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its clustered, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a rough texture, while its stems are woody and somewhat branched. Lantana boyacana is adapted to a variety of soil types and thrives in full sun, making it a resilient ornamental plant.
